content:
• Tuesday, February 14, 2017
  • FIG

    SoftBank acquiring Fortress Investment Group in $3.3B deal

    • Representing $8.08 per share, a 38.6% premium to Fortress Investment Group Class A common stock pricing as of yesterday, February 13. Principals at Fortress Investment Group will continue operation of the business on an independent basis.
    • SoftBank Group (SFTBY, SFTBF) chairman and CEO Masayoshi Son: "Fortress’s excellent track record speaks for itself, and we look forward to benefitting from its leadership, broad-based expertise and world-class investment platform. For SoftBank, this opportunity will immediately help expand our group capabilities, and, alongside our soon-to-be-established SoftBank Vision Fund platform, will accelerate our SoftBank 2.0 transformation strategy of bold, disciplined investment and world class execution to drive sustainable long-term growth."
    • Fortress Investment Group (NYSE:FIG) +24% at $7.70 after hours.
    • Earlier (February 14, 2017): WSJ: SoftBank nearing $3B+ acquisition of Fortress Investment Group
    • Press release [SoftBank Group]
     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM | 77 Comments
  • FIG

    WSJ: SoftBank nearing $3B+ acquisition of Fortress Investment Group

    • Fortress Investment Group (NYSE:FIG) +23% after hours.
    • Report [Wall Street Journal]
     
     
     
     
    | 6:03 PM | 12 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: SEDG +5.9%. A +4.3%. CCS +4.1%. PG +3.3%. SIRI +3.2%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: TRUP -15.3%. FOSL -12.3%. NAII -11.4%. LC -5.6%. AIG -4.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 16 Comments
  • PBPB

    Potbelly beats by $0.08, beats on revenue

    • Potbelly (NASDAQ:PBPB): Q4 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.08.
    • Revenue of $102.4M (+7.7% Y/Y) beats by $0.13M.
    • Shares +8.6% PM.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • MRK

    Merck halts Alzheimer’s trial; down 1%

    • There was "virtually no chance of finding a positive clinical effect," says the external Data Monitoring Committee as Merck (NYSE:MRK) halts the EPOCH study of Verubecestat for those with mild to moderate Alzheimer’s.
    • Shares down 1% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM | 7 Comments
  • LC

    Investors sell the news after LendingClub beats

    • Q4 originations of $1.987.3B vs. $2.579B a year ago. Net operating revenue of $129.2M vs. $134.5M; adjusted EBITDA of a loss of $2.2M vs. profit of $24.6M.
    • Adjusted EPS in Q4 of a loss of $0.02 vs. a loss of $0.04 in Q3 and profit of $0.05 a year ago.
    • Banks funded 31% of total originations in Q4, up from 13% in Q3.
    • End-of-year servicing portfolio of $11.1B up 24% Y/Y.
    • Full-year 2017 revenue is expected to be $565M-$595M vs. $495.5M in 2016. Adjusted EBITDA of $40M-$55M vs. a loss of $18.2M in 2016.
    • Q1 revenue is seen at $117M-$122M, with adjusted EBITDA of a loss of $5M-$10M.
    • Conference call at 5 ET
    • Previously: LendingClub beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Feb. 14)
    • LC -6.2% after hours, after a 26% gain YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 9 Comments
  • PG

    Procter & Gamble +4% on report of big Trian stake

    • The majority of the roughly $3.5B stake was picked up this quarter, according to CNBC's David Faber.
    • Nelson Peltz may speak with company management at some point, but reportedly has not yet done so.
    • PG +4.25% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 44 Comments
  • IOSP

    Innospec beats by $0.26, beats on revenue

    • Innospec (NASDAQ:IOSP): Q4 EPS of $1.09 beats by $0.26.
    • Revenue of $237.8M (-3.3% Y/Y) beats by $6.1M.
    • Shares +3%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • AIG

    AIG -2.8% after Q4 loss; buyback boosted

    • Q4 after-tax operating loss of $2.787B or $2.72 per share vs. loss of $1.318B and $1.07 per share one year ago. This year's result included a $5.6B, or $3.56 per share impact from prior year adverse reserve development. The deal with Berkshire's National Indemnity covers 80% of this.
    • Normalized ROE of 4.8% during Q4 compares to 6.6% a year ago. Full-year normalized ROE of 7.5% vs. 6.9% in 2015.
    • Expense reduction: Full-year general operating expenses fell 13.4% to $11B; excluding the sold AIG Advisor Group, operating expenses fell 9.7%.
    • $13.1B returned to owners in 2016, including $3B of common stock buybacks, $46M in warrants. Another $1.2B of stock has been repurchased thus far in 2017. The buyback is boosted by $3.5B, bringing remaining authority to $4.7B.
    • Conference call tomorrow at 8 ET
    • Previously: American International Group EPS of -$2.72 (Feb. 14)
    • AIG -2.8% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 24 Comments
  • KRNT

    Kornit Digital beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • Kornit Digital (NASDAQ:KRNT): Q4 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $34M (+33.3% Y/Y) beats by $1.22M.
    • Shares +1.4%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • BRK.A

    Buffett boosts airline bets, buys Monsanto and Sirius XM

    • Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A, BRK.B) discloses a new near-850K share stake in Monsanto (NYSE:MON), according to its just-filed 13F. Shares are higher by 1.25% after hours.
    • There's also a new near-750K share position in Sirius XM (NASDAQ:SIRI). Shares are higher by 2.5%, and a boosted bet on airlines with a more than 2M share stake in Southwest (NYSE:LUV), and increased holdings of Delta (NYSE:DAL) and American Airlines (NASDAQ:AAL). LUV +1.1%, DAL +0.75%, AAL +1.75%
    • Exited are stakes in Deere (NYSE:DE) and Kinder Morgan (NYSE:KMI), and positions in Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) and Verizon (NYSE:VZ) were lowered.
    • Other adds include: Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) and BNY Mellon (NYSE:BK).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 135 Comments
  • SEDG

    SolarEdge Technologies misses by $0.01, misses on revenue

    • SolarEdge Technologies (NASDAQ:SEDG): FQ2 EPS of $0.32 misses by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $111.5M (-10.7% Y/Y) misses by $4.32M.
    • Shares +2.08%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 19 Comments
  • LOGM

    LogMeIn -8.8% amid Amazon Chime release

    • Having just finalized merger with Citrix Systems' GoTo business (inclusive of GoToMeeting) earlier in February, LogMeIn (NASDAQ:LOGM) trades to its lowest levels in three months ($94.20) following Amazon's foray into the videoconferencing space.
    • Amazon Chime
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • ANTM

    Anthem fires back at Cigna

    • Anthem (ANTM -0.8%) says Cigna (CI -0.5%) does not have the right to terminate the two's merger deal, according to CNBC.
    • Earlier: Cigna terminates deal, seeks $1.85B termination fee, and more than $13B in damages.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 2 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: INVE +21%. GIG +13%. HIMX +11%. IOTS +9%. OCLR +9%.
    • Losers: UNXL -31%. GILT -16%. NTWK -10%. DYSL -9%. AMKR -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 9 Comments
  • CI

    Cigna terminates Anthem deal; seeks billions in damages

    • A judge last week blocked Cigna's (CI +1.2%) proposed merger with Anthem (ANTM -1.2%).
    • Cigna today formally terminates the agreement and is seeking a $1.85B reverse termination fee, along with additional damages of more than $13B "which includes the lost premium value to Cigna's shareholders caused by Anthem's willful breaches of the Merger Agreement."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 4 Comments
  • HE

    Hawaiian Electric's Q4 misses by a penny

    • Q4 core EPS of $0.41vs. estimates for $0.42. HE remains under halt, down 1.05%.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: Hawaiian Electric halted with news pending (Feb. 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: DELT +16%. CHNR +12%. TRCH +9%. FELP +8%. TORM +7%.
    • Losers: GEVO -31%. NAK -25%. ESES -9%. IO -7%. PLG -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • OMF

    OneMain up 9% despite bottom-line miss

    • Though earnings came in light, credit and leverage are "moving in the right direction," says FBR's Bob Ramsey, who rates the stock Market Perform.
    • He takes note of a slight improvement in 60-day delinquencies and reiteration of the 2017 net charge-off outlook.
    • Compass Point's Michael Tarkan upgrades OneMain (NYSE:OMF) to Buy from Neutral. His $31 price target compares to the current $26.62 (after today's 9.05% advance).
    • Previously: OneMain -3.7%; earnings miss (Feb. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM | 3 Comments
  • FRED

    Fred's +3.5% as BAML defends

    • During a client meeting last night, a senior BAML leveraged finance executive defended Fred's (FRED +3.5%) credit and ability to finance its store purchase from Rite-Aid (RAD +0.3%), according to Bloomberg.
    • Previously: Fred's updates on Walgreens deal (Jan. 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 31 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:45 PM

    • Gainers: ZAIS +102%. OTC:FNBC +15%. OMF +10%. WAC +7%. AAME +7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • SCG

    SCANA downgraded at Mizuho, as Toshiba woes add to uncertainty

    • SCANA (SCG -4.2%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy with a $68 price target, cut from $80, at Mizuho after Toshiba, the backer for the company's nuclear construction projects in the U.S., went into financial meltdown.
    • Mizuho says its investment thesis on SCG is changing for the worse following news that the company's construction consortium, spearheaded by Westinghouse and financially backed by Toshiba, may no longer be economically viable and that the burden of completing two new nuclear units may now fall on Scana alone.
    • The firm thinks it is time to step away from the stock until there is much more clarity about ultimate costs and earnings power.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 3 Comments
  • HAIN

    Hain Celestial still intriguing to Susquehanna

    • Susquehanna gives a shot in the arm to Hain Celestial (HAIN +0.1%) during a tough week for the food company amid ongoing accounting issues and a SEC subpoena.
    • "External auditors have now taken more than six months reviewing the numbers. Can things be that bad? Based on our crossing of the scanner data, natural food channel publicly listed disclosure, and what HAIN reported through March 2016, we do not expect more than a 2% restatement to FY16 (June)," reasons analyst Pablo Zuanic.
    • "We continue to see a valuation in the mid-$50s in a break up LBO type scenario," he adds.
    • Susquehana reaffirms its Positive rating on Hain and sticks with a December 2017 price target of $45, although it acknowledges the risk factor with its call has increased.
    • Previously: Hain Celestial lower amid filing delay, SEC subpoena (Feb. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 1 Comment

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: ZAIS +131%. PHMD +48%. CYNO +28%. RELV +28%. ZSAN +25%. INVE +22%. SALE +20%. APOP +17%. NMM +15%. DELT +14%.
    • Losers: AVIR -36%. GEVO -31%. NAK -26%. UNXL -25%. GILT -18%. CBIO -16%. VSR -15%. OHRP -15%. . HIBB -13%
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • RHHBY

    Bristol-Myers 'in play' - StreetInsider

    • Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY), Novartis (NYSE:NVS), and Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) are "thought to be kicking the tires," according to the report, which also cites Gilead (NASDAQ:GILD) as a potential buyer.
    • A deal could be worth as much as $72 per share.
    • BMY has popped 2% to $53.03.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 100 Comments
  • CCJ

    Cameco upped at BMO on improved uranium outlook; uranium stocks surge

    • Cameco (CCJ +3.6%) is upgraded to Outperform from Market Perform with an $18 price target, bumped up from $17, at BMO Capital, citing an improving uranium price outlook.
    • BMO also believes CCJ’s supply contract dispute with Tepco will be resolved through arbitration, a negative for near-term cash flows but an outcome that may provide a cash boost in the future.
    • The firm also highlights Kazakhstan’s decision to cut output by 10%, signaling that the country state-owned uranium giant will do whatever it takes to support prices.
    • Uranium names are broadly higher in today's trade: URA +2.6%, UEC +5.1%, UUUU +6.3% URRE +9.3%, DNN +3.8%, URG +4.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 9 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: RELV +21%. NAKD +9%. PME +7%. KATE +5%.
    • Losers: VNCE -18%. TTM -11%. OTC:FENX -9%. VUZI -9%. FLO -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • KATE

    Kate Spade jumps with takeover bids imminent

    • Kate Spade (KATE +5%) is expected to see the first round of takeover bids this month, according to dealReporter.
    • PE firms are expected to have the most interest in the retailer.
    • Shares of KATE are at their highest level of the year off the M&A buzz.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 5 Comments
  • BKD

    Brookdale Senior shrugs off weak quarter/outlook amid buyout interest

    • Brookdale Senior Living (NYSE:BKD) was initially sharply lower after last night's  "meaningfully short" earnings results and gloomy outlook, but it's the company's takeout value that matters, says Jefferies Brian Tanquilut.
    • Specifically, rumors of a coming deal with Blackstone have put an "artificial floor" under the stock price. Tanquilut rates BKD a Hold with $14 price target.
    • Shares are currently higher by 1.3% to $15.03.
    • Previously: Activist thinks Brookdale Senior is worth at least $25 per share (Jan. 13)
    • Previously: Brookdale Senior +17% on buyout chatter (Jan. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 5 Comments
  • CRI

    Carter's rallies after Piper points to upside

    • Shares of Carter's (CRI +1.8%) jump after Piper Jaffray analysts Stephanie Wissink upgrades the retailer to Overweight from Neutral.
    • Wissink thinks Carter's is set up to benefit from its investments in the online and mobile platforms.
    • Piper's price target of $100 reps 18% upside potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • NAK

    Northern Dynasty's Pebble deposit "not commercially viable," Kerrisdale says

    • Northern Dynasty Minerals (NAK -28.9%) plunges nearly 30% after Kerrisdale Capital Management, in a report published on Seeking Alpha, says the company's shares are "worthless" and the Pebble deposit "is not commercially viable."
    • NAK has soared more than 300% since election day on hopes that a more mining-friendly EPA will allow the Pebble project to move forward, but Kerrisdale says the political risks remain immense and the economics are an even bigger hurdle, as mining Pebble would require so much upfront investment that it would actually destroy value.
    • Kerrisdale believes NAK’s former partners concluded that the Pebble project had a negative present value, an assessment the company has spent years trying to conceal from public.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 30 Comments
  • CYBR

    CyberArk Software initiated at Buy at Stifel

    • Setting $62 target, firm notes CyberArk Software as the evident leader in the Privileged Account Management [PAM] sector, the company's unique focus within group of public security software providers and observed prospective IT shift to a model of "least privilege/zero-trust" considered advantageous.
    • CyberArk Software (NASDAQ:CYBR) $54.68, +3.43%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • VRML

    Vermillion up more than 14% as insiders add to bets

    • Several company directors, members of management, and significant shareholders have agreed to invest another $5.6M in the company in the form of common stock and warrants (exercisable at $1.80 six months after the private placement closes, and then for a period of five years).
    • VRML +14.4% to $1.59
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • BAC

    Dollar, banks on the move as Yellen leans hawkish

    • Testifying before the Senate this morning, Fed Chair Janet Yellen says it would be "unwise" to delay on rate hikes, thus suggesting a move in March could be more likely than previously thought.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is higher by 6.7 basis points to 2.50%, and Fed Funds futures are pricing in slightly more hawkish Fed policy for the remainder of the year.
    • Also notable was lack of much mention of regulation in Yellen's opening remarks. There had been thought that Yellen would use the opportunity to push back against Trump administration and congressional calls for a sizable rollback of Dodd-Frank and the stress test regime.
    • Welcoming news of higher rates (and no news yet on regulations) is the financial sector: (XLF +0.7%), (KBE +1.2%), (KRE +1.3%)
    • Bank of America (BAC +2%), Wells Fargo (WFC +1%), JPMorgan (JPM +1.2%), Citigroup (C +1.5%), Goldman Sachs (GS +1.2%), Morgan Stanley (MS +2%), Regionsl Financial (RF +1.8%), U.S. Bancorp (USB +0.2%), KeyCorp (KEY +1.5%), PNC Financial (PNC +0.8%), Fifth Third (FITB +1.6%), Lincoln National (LNC +1.7%) MetLife (MET +0.8%), AIG (AIG +0.8%)
    • The dollar (UUP +0.4%) has also moved higher since Yellen took the stage.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 35 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: PHMD +43%. CYNO +28%. ZSAN +16%. AGEN +13%. PZRX +11%.
    • Losers: AVIR -38%. CBIO -8%. RGLS -7%. OREX -6%. MYOS -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • DNR

    Denbury Resources sees 2017 capex up 44% Y/Y to ~$300M

    • Denbury Resources (DNR -2.1%) estimates its 2017 capital budget at $300M, 44% higher than in 2016, with 2017 production of 58K-62K boe/day; the midpoint of the range is roughly flat with DNR's 2016 exit rate of just under 60K boe/day.
    • DNR says its year-end total proved oil and natural gas reserves declined by a net 35M boe to 254M boe, consisting of 247M barrels of crude oil, condensate and natural gas liquids, and 44B cf of natural gas.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 6 Comments
  • APA

    Apache -3% as Alpine High results seen as disappointing

    • Apache (APA -2.8%) opens lower after presenting highly anticipated delineation results for its recently discovered Alpine High oil field.
    • Piper Jaffray analyst Pearce Hammond says Midland Basin results were strong but Alpine High results were weaker than previous on a lateral adjusted basis, although APA highlights confirmation of “second landing zone” in the Woodford and extension of the play south into Pecos County.
    • Johnson Rice's Charles Meade sees incremental results as generally positive but a bit disappointing in the number of new wells, likely providing Alpine High skeptics with ammunition in the low level of liquids production in the new wells.
    • RBC's Scott Hanold says Midland results appear positive vs. other top industry wells, while Alpine High results reveal over-pressure gas window extending further to the south but productivity levels do not warrant a “re-rating” of the play.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 2 Comments
  • QSR

    Popeyes likely to stay in M&A crosshairs

    • Shares of Popeyes Lousiana Kitchen (PLKI) have peeled back 4.9% of yesterday's late rally, but still trade higher than where they stood at the beginning of the week.
    • TheStreet.com's Brian Sozzi isn't convinced that Popeyes ultimately isn't an enticing target for Restaurant Brands Group.
    • "There is significant opportunity for a larger, more experienced global operator such as Restaurant Brands to quickly roll-out new Popeyes locations," writes Sozzi. He also notes the cool factor that QSR could infuse into the Popeyes chain.
    • Popeyes currently has 2,594 restaurants globally vs. the +4K target set by the company.
    • Previously: Popeyes flys higher with Restaurant Brands on the hunt (Feb. 13)
    • Previously: Popeyes Louisiana Kitchen falls after NY Post tips no QSR buyout (Feb. 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • WSO

    More on Watsco's Q4

    • Watsco (WSO -4%) saw 2% growth in HVAC equipment, including 3% growth in the U.S.
    • Commercial refrigeration products sales grew 6%.
    • Gross margin rate improved 40 bps to 25%.
    • SG&A expense rate flat at 18.6%.
    • Operating margin rate expanded 40 bps to 6.4%.
    • Q4 results
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • TERP

    TerraForm Power upgraded to Neutral from Sell at UBS

    • TerraForm Power (TERP +1.6%) is upgraded to Neutral from Sell with an $11.50 price target at UBS, which says further share movement is largely dependent on the company's ongoing strategic review, including prospects for an acquisition.
    • UBS does not anticipate substantial re-contracting or PPA cancellation risk in the near term, and believes TERP's fundamentals remain intact.
    • Brookfield's cash bids of $11.50/share for TERP alone provides a support level for shares, while the $12 level including TerraForm Global (GLBL -0.5%) provides "some viable upside," the firm says.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 44 Comments
  • PFLT

    PennantPark Floating Rate -3% after capital raise

    • The offering price for the 5M shares was $13.62, but the external manager - PennantPark Investment Advisers - has agreed to pay the underwriters a supplemental payment of $0.46 per share, bringing net proceeds to PFLT to $70.4M, or $14.08 per share.
    • The underwriters still have a greenshoe option to buy another 750K shares.
    • The stock's lower by 3.3% to $13.55.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • ZG

    Zillow upgraded to Buy at Stifel

    • From Hold, analyst George Askew notes implementation of a roughly 50% increase in pricing on leads for new contracts among Zillow's Premier Agent program in early February. Derives, given expected impact to contract renewals, a 500 bps addition to overall revenue growth rate for 2017.
    • Price target from $36 to $43.
    • (NASDAQ:ZG) $35.77, +2.83%; (NASDAQ:Z) $36.09, +2.56%
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 4 Comments
  • MU

    Micron down another 4% on sell-side caution

    • via Notable Calls
    • Deutsche hosted a talk with some of Micron Technology's (MU -4.1%) management yesterday. Biggest takeaway: Micron no longer expects DRAM prices to increase in H2 of this year and 2018.
    • JPMorgan's JJ Park says he and team are seeing signs of softness in PC DRAM spot prices, which were flat to down over the last couple of sessions. DRAM demand risks are clearly on the rise, they say, given BOM pressure on smartphone OEMs, and lukewarm emerging market demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM | 123 Comments
  • NTAP

    NetApp upgraded to Overweight at Piper Jaffray

    • From Neutral, analyst Andrew Nowinski notes expectation for NetApp to realize mid-single digit growth in revenue, the company's all-flash market advantages, broad software portfolio generative of revenue in public cloud and software-defined storage segments, its tracking toward 20% operating margin by 2020, bettering near-term demand direction, appealing valuation and sound balance sheet.
    • Price target from $37 to $46.
    • NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP) $40.06, +1.21% pre-market.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: CYNO +28%. NMM +21%. CBIO +16%. SINO +15%. RELV +15%. AGEN +14%. DCIX +13%. GIG +13%. TRXC +9%. ZSAN +9%. MRNS +7%. STNG +7%. FCEL +6%. ESEA +6%.
    • Losers: BTI -50%. AVIR -35%. GEVO -25%. UNXL -17%. HIBB -14%. PLX -12%. VG -12%. AMKR -12%. VSR -9%. GILT -8%. NTWK -7%. TTM -7%. RCII -6%. PIP -5%. PLKI -5%. NAK -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 4 Comments
  • MGM

    Tracinda lightens up a bit more on MGM Resorts

    • Tracinda reports a reduced stake in MGM Resorts International (NYSE:MGM) of 13.80% from 14.51%.
    • It's not unexpected that Tracinda has been lowering its MGM position since the death of Kirk Kerkorian.
    • SEC Form 4
    • MGM +0.99% premarket to $29.45.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 3 Comments
  • IAG

    Iamgold says Saramacca assay results confirm significant mineralization

    • Iamgold (NYSE:IAG) +2.7% premarket after saying assay results from the initial exploration program at the Saramacca project in Suriname are "encouraging and appear to confirm the presence of significant mineralization."
    • The 2016 drilling program comprises ~14,600 meters from 67 diamond drill holes and 4,500 metres from 37 reverse circulation drill holes.
    • IAG says the 2017 exploration program has begun, with two diamond drill rigs currently operating; results from the phase one drilling program comprised of ~15K meters of diamond drilling will be incorporated into a deposit model to support an initial NI 43-101 compliant resource estimate expected for completion by Q3 2017.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • UNXL

    UniPixel -16%; announces public share offering, warrants to purchase stock

    • To be handled on a "best efforts" basis, the offering will be led by Roth Capital Partners, with Ladenburg Thalmann and The Benchmark Company as co-placement agents.
    • UniPixel (NASDAQ:UNXL) $1.24.
    • Press release / 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 11 Comments
  • SALE

    RetailMeNot on the fly after revenue guidance pleases

    • Shares of RetailMeNot (NASDAQ:SALE) perk up after a comfortable earnings beat from the e-commerce operation.
    • Total website visits were down 12% to 18.9M in the quarter, while mobile unique visitors were flat at 23.1M.
    • Looking ahead, RetailMeNot expects Q1 revenue of $62.5M-$71.5M and adjusted EBITDA of $7.5M to $11.5M. For the full year, the company sees revenue of $296M-$326M vs. $295M consensus.
    • Previously: RetailMeNot beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (Feb. 14)

    Hologic takes out Cynosure for $1.65B ($66/share)

    Incyte takes over development of GITR/OX40 from Agenus under amended agreement, Agenus up 7% premarket on $20M milestone

    • Agenus (NASDAQ:AGEN) perks up 7% premarket on increased volume in response to the news that it has amended its 2009 License, Development and Commercialization Agreement with Incyte (NASDAQ:INCY) regarding antibody programs GITR and OX40.
    • The partnership will now transition from co-funded development and profit-sharing to royalty-bearing for Agenus, who will receive 15% of global net sales in addition to a $20M milestone payment. Incyte will be responsible for clinical development and commercialization activities.
    • The ongoing TIM-3 and LAG-3 antibody programs will remain royalty-bearing at tiered rates of 6% and 12%, respectively, with Incyte retaining exclusive global clinical development and commercialization responsibilities.
    • Separately, the companies have entered into a Stock Purchase Agreement whereby Incyte will buy 10M shares of AGEN common at $6.

  • GILD

    Gilead's HIV candidate bictegravir shows robust treatment effect in mid-stage study; shares ahead 1% premarket

    • Results from a 98-subject Phase 2 clinical trial assessing Gilead Sciences' (NASDAQ:GILD) integrase strand transfer inhibitor bictegravir (BIC) and emtricitabine/tenofovir alafenamide (FTC/TAF) compared to dolutegravir (DTG) and FTC/TAF showed both regimens produced high virologic response rates at Week 24 and Week 48. The data were presented at the Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections in Seattle, WA.
    • At Week 24, 97% (n=63/65) of patients receiving BIC + FTC/TAF and 94% (n=31/33) of those receiving DTG + FTC/TAF achieved HIV-1 RNA levels less than 50 copies/mL. At Week 48, the proportions were 97% and 91%, respectively. No viral resistance was detected in the BIC+FTC/TAF arm.
    • “We are pleased with these positive Phase 2 data, which we believe demonstrate that bictegravir in combination with the FTC/TAF backbone potentially represents a potent new treatment option and an important evolution in HIV therapy,” said Norbert Bischofberger, PhD, Executive Vice President, Research and Development and Chief Scientific Officer, Gilead Sciences. “Based on the data observed in this study, we rapidly advanced the combination of bictegravir and FTC/TAF into four Phase 3 clinical trials. The studies are fully enrolled and we look forward to the availability of these data later this year.”
     
     
     
     
    | 7:27 AM | 25 Comments

  • VXRT

    Aviragen's vapendavir flunks mid-stage study in asthmatics with rhinovirus infection

    • Thinly traded nano cap Aviragen Therapeutics (AVIR) is set for an ugly day on the news that its Phase 2b clinical trial, SPIRITUS, assessing vapendavir in patients with moderate-to-sever asthma with rhinovirus infection failed to beat placebo.
    • Chief Joseph Patti, Ph.D., says, “We are disappointed that the SPIRITUS trial did not meet its primary endpoint in this patient population. There was evidence of an antiviral effect in patients that received vapendavir within the first day following the onset of their symptoms, and as such, we plan to take time to fully analyze the data before making a decision on whether to initiate a study in hematopoietic stem cell transplant patients, where the ability to stop the progression of the RV infection could be beneficial."
    • Vapendavir is a small molecule oral capsid-binding antiviral.
